result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse M. Sommerfeldt #467993 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse M. Sommerfeldt #467993 is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse M. Sommerfeldt #467993 was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While Revoked (Misdemeanor)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Jesse M. Sommerfeldt  #467993 in court, in custody with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 1 without repeater. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 10 days jail, consecutive to any other sentences, Huber granted, $443 costs, 60 days to pay fine or set up a payment plan with Clerk of Courts. No jail credit. Ct. 2 dismissed.
with Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus for New Lisbon Correctional Institution on 10/15/14 at 2:45 P.M.
